alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 11:35AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Randolph, Pocahontas, southeastern Nicholas, southeastern Upshur, Webster, southeastern Barbour and southeastern Fayette Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1134 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Buckhannon to near Babcock State Park. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Richwood, Marlinton, Greenbank, Webster Springs, Cass Scenic Railroad, Belington, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Snowshoe, Dailey, Holly River State Park, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Mingo, Beverly, Cowen, Junior and Durbin. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 31 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
